sentence.idiomatic: Help, save me! I'm being robbed.
He was arrested for robbery.
He was robbed yesterday.
During this competition, the team members all understood the ruthlessness of competition.
He is unable to accept such cruel realities in a short time.
Having broken through the brutal elimination round, she finally entered the final four.
These unreasonable rules should have been done away with a long time ago.
A lot of people oppose the abolishing the death penalty at the present stage.
In the last little while some people on the internet have demanded that traditional Chinese medicine be abolished.
I don't dare believe that you could do such an absurd thing.
Your doing it this way is really absurd.
Before, I had only seen this kind of absurd thing happen on television. I never realized that today it would happen to me personally.
His parents spoiling him caused him to become a lawless person.
Don't think that when the boss isn't around and you can disobey the rules.
Now children all have been pampered to the point that they don't obey any rules.
You have to understand me--I had no choice but to do this.
No one was willing to go. Being forced to, I had no choice but to go.
After being forced, we had no choice but to give up this plan.
She kept professing her innocence, but no one believed her.
Facing the innocent expression in that pair of eyes, I think that it would be impossible for anyone to be hardhearted enough to harm him.
What do you say: who is it that really is the innocent victim of the incident?
No matter who the person is, those who do bad things must be punished.
Drunk drivers will be given severe punishment.
This time is my fault--I accept the punishment.
Think about it carefully, we can find that what she just said is self-contradictory.
What he says and what he does are plainly contradictory, yet you surprisingly believed him.
He discovered that the new government policy that had been made public had areas that were contradictory.
They are talking rubbish, do not believe them.
As soon as she started talking, we knew that she was again just talking sheer nonsense.
I am not talking rubbish--everything I am saying is the truth. You have to believe me.
Nowadays, some people have a lot of nerve. Over some trifle they will commit robbery or murder. Good thing we have the death penalty.

How can you say such a thing? The death penalty is so brutal. This kind of archaic punishment doesn't fit in at all with the society today. It should have been abolished a long time ago. Actually, the vast majority of developed countries have to some extent abolished capital punishment--China should too.

That's absurd. The United States and Japan still have capital punishment, don't they? Without the death penalty, those evildoers committing murder and arson would be even more lawless. When that happens what stability will there be in society? How will the average citizen be able to live?

You can't say that. I've seen a lot of research statistics, and they all say that the death penalty isn't necessarily related to the crime rate. A lot of people commit crimes because they are compelled to. Furthermore, what about when you run into a mistaken conviction? Kill an innocent person for nothing?

What do you know? For offenses with especially serious penalties, the death penalty is irreplaceable. With regard to those especially grave crimes, if cold-blooded killers don't receive the punishment of the law, is that just?
We can't look at this problem using that kind of a concept of retaliation. All life is precious--the death penalty violates the principles of humanitarianism.

You are contradicting yourself. The life of the victim is also precious, and he or she was killed for what? Besides, in the past few years China has already controlled and reduced the use of the death penalty, and has also reformed the implementation of the death penalty. Isn't this showing enough respect for life?
We should completely abolish the death penalty, in this way allowing society as a whole to appreciate the principles of concern and the value for life.

You should talk a little less if you don't know what you're talking about. Wait until the day comes when murder or arson affects you personally, then you will realize the necessity of capital punishment.
